thread.title: EastEnders Danny-Boy Hatchard calls Lee Carter role a "real honour" while thanking viewers for support
thread.title_full: EastEnders Danny-Boy Hatchard calls Lee Carter role a "real honour" while thanking viewers for support

author: Nicola Agius
title: EastEnders Danny-Boy Hatchard calls Lee Carter role a "real honour" while thanking viewers for support
text:
Get soaps   Thank you for subscribing!   
EastEnders star Danny-Boy Hatchard has told thanked viewers for their support and love during his three years at the BBC One soap. 
In a video posted to Twitter on Friday evening, the actor - who played Lee Carter - told viewers that having a “positive impact on someone else’s life” had been the biggest reward of his career. 
Danny-Boy’s final scenes as Lee aired on Friday night. 
“These past three years you have been amazing, really, really amazing,” he told fans afterwards. “I’ve had an incredible time at EastEnders helping create Lee as a character and helping bring awareness to mental health.” 
“It’s been a real honour and I couldn’t have done it without your support,” he added. Danny-Boy said the role had been a real honour (Photo: Twitter) EastEnders' Lee with dad Mick (Photo: BBC) He thanked fans for their support (Photo: Twitter) 
“Thank you from the bottom of my heart. To be an actor and be able to have a positive impact on someone else’s life is the biggest reward, I think, that any actor could ever ask for, and to have you guys’ support is the cherry on top. 
“So thank you from the bottom of my heart. I love you dearly and I hope to see you all again in the future.” 
After arriving in Albert Square as the son of Mick and Linda, former squaddie Lee decided to pack his bags to start a new life in Dover on Friday's episode of the soap. 
His departure left wife Whitney in floods of tears. 
Before jumping into a black cab, his dad Mick called out to him for one last heart-to-heart to say goodbye. Lee Carter (DANNY-BOY HATCHARD) (Photo: BBC) Danny-Boy has been in the soap for three years (Photo: BBC) 
However, Mick - who encouraged him to leave in the first place - didn't attempt to talk him into staying. 
Instead, he wished him well and said the family would always be there for him should he ever need them. 
Actor Danny-Boy described his final scenes as the "end of an era". 
Taking to Twitter, he wrote: "Duf duf duf duf duf duf duf #endofanera #EastEnders." 
Fortunately for fans, the door has been left open for the Walford favourite to return. Lee Carter (DANNY-BOY HATCHARD), Whitney Carter (SHONA MCGARTY) (Photo: BBC) Lee with Whitney on their wedding day (Photo: BBC) 
Lee isn't the only member of the Carter family to be leaving town. 
Danny Dyer , who plays Mick, is said to be “exhausted” with his schedule and is taking some time out from the soap over the next few weeks - but there are fears he could now quit the soap. 
Three years ago, Danny was struck off work on doctor’s orders, after he vomited on set, and now producers are concerned he may be suffering again. 
Yesterday, a spokeswoman for the show said: “Danny is on a short break from EastEnders. This was not enforced by bosses nor has he quit the show.” 
EastEnders returns to BBC One on Monday at 8pm Like us on Facebook
